business.headline: Will gold continue to glitter this wedding season?Gold has always been the heart of Indian wedding traditions, but surging prices and evolving tastes are forcing families to rethink their buying strategy. As the wedding season peaks, one question rings loud — will gold still shine bright, and should you buy now or wait?

Thinking of buying digital gold? Sebi warns it's not a regulated productSebi further clarified that investor protection mechanisms applicable to regulated securities will not extend to such unregulated digital gold schemes.

Musk to pocket $1,000,000,000,000. What will he do with all the money?Elon Musk has been one of the world's richest people for several years now. And a $1 trillion pay package, which comes with conditions, will only make him richer. It has led social media to wonder how Musk, who is known not to live an extravagant life, will spend his money.

Wills aren't just for the old. Here's why you should have one tooFor most Indians, a will is something you think about when your hair turns grey, or you are on their deathbeds, but making a will early can be one of the most responsible things you do for your future.

Gold vs real estate: Where should you invest?Safe glitter or solid bricks? Investors have always loved gold and property, but choosing between the two can be tricky. With inflation, demand, and prices on the rise, it's time to ask—where you should put your money.

Adani Power bags Bhagalpur's 2,400 MW project tenderFour qualified bidders participated in the tender, with Adani Power quoting the lowest electricity tariff of Rs 6.075 per kWh (or per unit), sources with direct knowledge of the bidding process said.

Gold trades at around Rs 1.21 lakh per 10 grams: Should you buy or wait?Gold's shine shows no sign of fading as global uncertainty, a weak dollar, and festive demand keep prices high. But should investors buy now or wait for the next dip?
Sensex, Nifty end week in red amid weak global cues and FII sellingThe S&P BSE Sensex was down by 94.73 points to end at 83,216.28, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 17.40 points to close at 25,492.30.

BSE share price jumps nearly 9% despite market slump. Here's what drove the rallyAt the end of the trading session on November 7, BSE shares closed 8.61% higher at Rs 2,666.90 apiece on the NSE, bucking the overall market trend.

Lenskart IPO listing next week: Will it deliver profits or disappoint?Lenskart IPO received a strong response from investors, and was subscribed 28.27 times overall, indicating robust demand across categories.

Not 1, 3, or Rs 5 crore. Here's how much Shiv Nadar donated per day last yearShiv Nadar and his family donated a total of Rs 2,708 crore in the last year, which comes to nearly Rs 7.4 crore per day. This is the fourth time in five years that Nadar has topped the list.

Why urban millennials are renting lifestyle products instead of buying themUrban millennials are rewriting the rules of ownership. Instead of buying lifestyle products, from furniture to gadgets, they're choosing to rent. The reason? Flexibility, affordability, and freedom from long-term commitments.

Planning voluntary retirement under UPS? All you need to knowThe guidelines aim to offer clarity and smoother planning for retirement decisions, ensuring eligible employees understand their rights, timelines, and benefits under UPS.

Groww IPO closes today. Here's what the latest GMP signalsWith the IPO closing today, attention now shifts to final subscription numbers and post-allotment reactions. Analysts expect a modestly positive debut given the strong retail response and steady grey market sentiment.

Financial watchdog to seek RBI's help in IndusInd Bank forex hedging probeAs of now, EOW officials have recorded statements of around 12 people from IndusInd Bank, which includes the former top management and other employees in connection with the ongoing investigations into the accounting lapse at the bank of Rs 2000 crore.

Why a magical 12% SIP may not give you solid returns? Expert breaks it downEither compare everything in nominal terms, without adjusting for inflation, or adjust every single figure — contributions, taxes, fees, and final value — for inflation, says expert.

Gold and silver are rising again. What's driving the fresh rally?On Friday morning, gold futures on the MCX were trading around Rs 1,21 lakh per 10 grams, while silver was trading over Rs 1,48 lakh per kg. Both metals have rebounded from their one-week lows, aided by a weaker US dollar and fresh geopolitical tensions.

Elon Musk's $1 trillion payday sounds huge. But can he actually earn it?To actually collect on this historic paycheque, Musk must achieve what Tesla's board calls "Mars-shot milestones", a suite of operational and financial targets.

Sensex tumbles 500 points: Why stock market is down todayThe broad-based weakness comes as investors continue to digest a mix of global uncertainties, ranging from geopolitical tensions to expectations of prolonged high interest rates in the US.

Lenskart IPO allotment out: Check latest GMP, listing date and moreLenskart's IPO allotment is done, but all eyes are now on its stock market debut. With strong demand and a steady GMP, will India's eyewear leader deliver clear gains?

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss Tamil 9: Tushaar evicted, Vijay Sethupathi roasts Diwaker The latest episode of 'Bigg Boss Tamil 9', hosted by Vijay Sethupathi, brought drama with a staged fight prank, heated confrontations, and Tushaar's eviction. Wildcard twists and emotional goodbyes kept viewers hooked.

R Madhavan's intense first look from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar out After Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan's first-look poster from 'Dhurandhar' is out. Starring Ranveer Singh, the film will be out in theatres in December 2025.

Kim Kardashian fails bar exam again, vows to study harder and try once more Kim Kardashian's journey to becoming a lawyer hit a bump after she failed the California bar exam in July 2025. Undeterred, she vowed to study harder and try again, staying committed to her six-year mission and inspiring many with her determination.

The Girlfriend box office Day 2: Rashmika's emotional drama sees strong growth Rashmika Mandanna's 'The Girlfriend' is off to a strong start, nearly doubling its Day 2 box office with Rs 2.5 crore. With rising occupancy and positive word-of-mouth, the film is winning praise for Rashmika's heartfelt performance and growing audience appeal.

Why Anupama Parameswaran filed cyber case against 20-year-old woman: Read here Actor Anupama Parameswaran has reported an organised online harassment campaign to the Kerala Cyber Crime Police, calling attention to the growing issue of cyberbullying. She urged people to use social media responsibly.

Backstreet's Back (not really): Why the boy band era isn't coming back Boy bands once dominated global pop culture with perfect harmony and billion-dollar backing. Their decline came with the rise of hip-hop, reality TV, and fragmented music consumption.

Sussanne Khan remembers her 'god' Zarine Khan in touching post: You took our hearts Sussanne Khan and Farah Khan Ali pay tribute to their mother Zarine Khan, who died in Mumbai, with heartfelt messages and memories. The actor was 81 and died due to age-related issues.

Ram Charan, Janhvi Kapoor join AR Rahman at Hyderabad concert to celebrate Peddi Ram Charan and Janhvi Kapoor made a special appearance at AR Rahman's Hyderabad concert, marking their collaboration for the upcoming film 'Peddi'. The evening included a live performance of the song 'Chikiri' and heartfelt moments on stage.

Haq box office Day 2: Yami-Emraan's films stays steady, earns Rs 5 crore Emraan Hashmi and Yami Gautam's courtroom drama 'Haq' opens to a promising Rs 5.10 crore in two days, inspired by a landmark Supreme Court ruling on Muslim women's rights. The film's strong performances and socially relevant narrative have garnered critical acclaim and audience support.

The Family Man: How to spy, survive, and stay best friends - ft. Srikant & JK In 'The Family Man 3', beyond the covert missions and political intrigue, it's really about companionship under fire. Srikant Tiwari and JK Talpade's friendship brings heart, humour, and humanity to a world built on secrets.

Sobhita Dhulipala's Telugu wins over husband Naga Chaitanya Naga Chaitanya and Sobhita Dhulipala's bond draws attention as they share insights on language, identity, and comfort ahead of their December anniversary.

Bigg Boss 19 Day 76: Salman Khan blasts Neelam, Farrhana for double standards Host Salman Khan openly questioned the actions and attitudes of Neelam Giri and Farrhana Bhatt in the latest 'Bigg Boss 19' episode aired on 8 November 2025.Tensions rose as Khan addressed the behaviour of multiple contestants, with reports suggesting possible eliminations on the horizon.

Mahesh Babu teases Globetrotter glimpse event, to stream on JioHotstar. Details Mahesh Babu has announced the first event for his upcoming SS Rajamouli film 'Globetrotter', set for November 15 in Hyderabad. The event will be livestreamed on JioHotstar.

Ishaan Khatter, Vishal Jethwa attend Homebound screening with Martin Scorsese The 'Homebound' team marked a special evening in New York, joining executive producer Martin Scorsese for a screening. Director Neeraj Ghaywan and lead actors Ishaan Khatter and Vishal Jethwa were in attendance.

Vijay Varma opens up on battling depression, and how Ira Khan helped him heal Actor Vijay Varma has spoken out about his long-standing emotional struggles, shaped by a fraught relationship with his father and a difficult decade before his breakthrough in 'Gully Boy'. He credited Ira Khan for guiding him towards therapy during a deep depressive episode in the lockdown.

Deepika Padukone recalls facing colourism, stereotypes in Hollywood During a recent conversation, Deepika Padukone spoke about her experiences in Hollywood. She highlighted the persistent stereotypes about India in the West and discussed the challenges she faced, including being offered cliched roles and confronting colourism.

Thalapathy Kacheri from Vijay's Jana Nayagan is Anirudh's fan anthem for actor The first single 'Thalapathy Kacheri' from Vijay's upcoming film 'Jana Nayagan' has been released, featuring a high-energy fan anthem by Anirudh. The film, marking Vijay's last performance as an actor, is scheduled to hit theatres on January 9, 2026.

Mahhi Vij back home after hospitalisation, shares pic with family Actor Mahhi Vij has been discharged from the hospital after being admitted due to a high fever. She shared a health update on Instagram on Saturday.

Priyanka Chopra's Hindi twist to Last Christmas: Video and reactions here Priyanka Chopra Jonas has made a musical comeback with a Hindi version of George Michael's 'Last Christmas' for the festive film 'Christmas Karma', sparking mixed reactions online. While some fans appreciate her bold and nostalgic effort, others criticise the bilingual lyrics and translation.

general news.headline: Like Nehru or Indira, LK Advani can't be judged by one episode: Shashi TharoorShashi Tharoor's birthday wishes and praise for LK Advani's "life of service" sparked backlash online, with a Supreme Court advocate accusing the Congress MP of glossing over the BJP veteran's role in divisive politics.

ISIS recruiter, murder convict seen using phones, watching TV in Bengaluru jailVideos of high-risk inmates using phones and watching TV at Bengaluru's Parappana Agrahara jail have triggered a probe into serious security lapses and preferential treatment.

Leader of Partying: BJP mocks Rahul Gandhi's jungle safari amid Bihar pollsRahul Gandhi's jungle safari in Madhya Pradesh triggered sharp political reactions, with the BJP accusing him of vacationing amid the Bihar polls and mocking him as the "Leader of Partying".

Tamil Nadu woman, lesbian partner arrested after husband alleges they killed sonA Tamil Nadu man has alleged his wife and her partner killed their five-month-old son. Police have arrested both women as investigations continue into the suspicious death.

The next wave of layoffs might not be in offices but on the streetsDrones are being used for deliveries in Gurgaon and Bengaluru. Amazon is trying out AI automation at its warehouses. But the 12 million people in India's gig economy are oblivious of that. From millions of additions to the workforce to automation, India's gig economy is set for an upheaval. Will that be the end of the road for the millions who are always on the move but never move up?

'Do you know about Mamdani?' Masked US immigration agents grill Indian-origin manAn Indian-American employee of the Illinois Department of Transportation was stopped by masked agents at a worksite, prompting condemnation from the governor and raising questions about the agents' authority and motives.

Bihar's new Purnea Airport gets a Madhepura hug 💩Bihar's newest airport at Purnea didn't just get flights. It also got a defecation drama from Purnea's neighbour, Madhepura. This is a small story that started as a messy online spat and, later, turned into a cross-district Instagram collab. All as poop hit the roof.

Can't our children sing patriotic songs? Kerala school writes to PM amid RSS rowIn his letter to PM Modi, the school's principal, Dinto K.P. pointed out that Southern Railway's official X handle deleted the post "after 2 Malayalam news channels, 24 News, and Media 1, criticised the song as being associated with the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh."

Is Shubman Gill a burden to India's new-age T20I team?Shubman Gill is a generational talent, no doubt. But if his tempo disrupts India's T20I rhythm and forces others out of position, the question isn't whether he is good enough. It's whether he is the right fit for a side that has succeeded by attacking fearlessly.

'Found naked in drain, bite marks on cheek': Bengal girl, 4, kidnapped and rapedProtests erupted inside Tarakeswar Rural Hospital in Bengal's Hooghly as BJP workers accused police of acting only after public outrage, hours after the child was found bleeding and her family's pleas allegedly went unheard.

The New Luxury: How Republic of Nature Redefines Meaningful Living on ECRDiscover how Republic of Nature by GTB Developers is reshaping Chennai's East Coast Road with design-forward homes that blend luxury, nature, and mindfulness in one of India's most refined new communities.

Bishnoi gang member among 2 of India's wanted gangsters arrested in US, GeorgiaVenkatesh Garg, tied to Kapil Sangwan's Nandu gang, was arrested in Georgia, while Bhanu Rana, a Lawrence Bishnoi aide with networks across Haryana, Punjab, and Delhi, was caught in the US.

R Madhavan's intense first look from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar outAfter Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan's first-look poster from 'Dhurandhar' is out. Starring Ranveer Singh, the film will be out in theatres in December 2025.
5.4-magnitude earthquake shakes Andaman and Nicobar IslandsAn earthquake shook the Andaman and Nicobar Islands on Sunday afternoon. Sources revealed that the magnitude was 5.4.

Employee posts contrasting leave approval replies from Indian, Japanese bossesAn employee's Reddit post shows the stark differences in leave approval by Japanese and Indian managers, which led to questions about empathy and cultural work norms in professional settings.

Live: Bihar's youth want jobs, not Instagram, says Rahul Gandhi in attack on BJPBihar Election 2025 News Live: On the last day of campaigning for the final of Bihar Assembly elections, all the parties are putting their full strength into attracting voters. BJP leader and Union Home Minister will address two public meetings today. Congress leader Rahul Gandhi will also address two rallies. Several other leaders from both NDA and Mahagathbandhan are also expected to hold rallies. The second and final phase of Bihar elections are scheduled for November 11 and the counting of votes will take place on November 14. Stay tuned with indiatoday.in for the latest updates.

After the Oscar nod: Rima Das and the story you haven't heardShe made Assam visible to the world with Village Rockstars. Now, in Anything But, Rima Das talks about what fame changes, her take on love, life and Zubeen da.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Notorious elements drive Thar: Haryana top cop's remark divides InternetCalling Thar SUVs and Bullet motorcycles symbols of a "notorious mindset", Haryana DGP OP Singh said people driving such vehicles often perform road stunts and use them to show off power and status.

Will gold continue to glitter this wedding season?Gold has always been the heart of Indian wedding traditions, but surging prices and evolving tastes are forcing families to rethink their buying strategy. As the wedding season peaks, one question rings loud — will gold still shine bright, and should you buy now or wait?

Escapade Mars mission launch tonight: Bezos to attempt rocket landingBlue Origin will attempt to land the massive New Glenn rocket's first stage on a recovery ship at sea, aiming to enhance rocket reusability.

Afghan-Pak peace talks collapse after Islamabad's 'beyond capacity' demandPeace talks between Afghanistan and Pakistan collapsed after Islamabad demanded Kabul take responsibility for Pakistan's internal security, a condition the Taliban called "beyond capacity."

Muzaffarnagar police issue Rs 20 lakh challan to scooter rider by mistake. Pic viralA scooter owner in Muzaffarnagar, Uttar Pradesh, was left stunned after being fined over Rs 20 lakh for traffic violations. A photo of the challan, which went viral on social media, was later confirmed to be a clerical error by the police.

Was not sure if Australia would let me cross their border: Jemimah RodriguesJemimah Rodrigues joked while playing in the Women's Big Bash League that she was not sure whether she would be allowed to cross the Australian border. Jemimah's epic knock of 127* knocked Australia out of the World Cup.

R Madhavan's intense first look from Ranveer Singh's Dhurandhar outAfter Arjun Rampal, R Madhavan's first-look poster from 'Dhurandhar' is out. Starring Ranveer Singh, the film will be out in theatres in December 2025.

Kim Kardashian fails bar exam again, vows to study harder and try once moreKim Kardashian's journey to becoming a lawyer hit a bump after she failed the California bar exam in July 2025. Undeterred, she vowed to study harder and try again, staying committed to her six-year mission and inspiring many with her determination.

sports.headline: Sundar wins Impact Player award after India seal T20I series vs Australia Washington Sundar received the 'Impact Player of the Series' medal after India clinched the T20I series 2-1 in Australia. The all-rounder was all smiles as team operations manager Rahil Khaja presented him with the award.

Is Shubman Gill a burden to India's new-age T20I team? Shubman Gill is a generational talent, no doubt. But if his tempo disrupts India's T20I rhythm and forces others out of position, the question isn't whether he is good enough. It's whether he is the right fit for a side that has succeeded by attacking fearlessly.

More valuable than Jasprit Bumrah: Badrinath's stunning claim on India bowler Former cricketer Subramaniam Badrinath feels that Varun Chakravarthy is a more valuable player for India than star pacer Jasprit Bumrah. Chakravarthy picked up five wickets in five matches for India during the Australia series.

Women's World Champion Shafali Verma gets hero's welcome in hometown Rohtak India's Women's World Cup 2025 star Shafali Verma received a hero's welcome as she returned to her hometown of Rohtak. Shafali was the Player Of The Match in the final as India defeated South Africa.

Was not sure if Australia would let me cross their border: Jemimah Rodrigues Jemimah Rodrigues joked while playing in the Women's Big Bash League that she was not sure whether she would be allowed to cross the Australian border. Jemimah's epic knock of 127* knocked Australia out of the World Cup.

Hong Kong Sixes: Another defeat, India finish campaign with 4 losses in a row India finished their Hong Kong sixes campaign with yet another defeat. The Dinesh Karthik side lost to Sri Lanka in their final match of the invitational tournament. After starting with a win against Pakistan, India lost matches to Kuwait, UAE, Nepal and Sri Lanka.

No more experiments: Aakash Chopra's advice to India after Australia T20I series win Former cricketer Aakash Chopra has advised the Indian team management to stop experimenting after they wrapped up the Australia T20I series. India experimented with their batting and bowling during the series win against the Aussies.

After World Cup heroics, Jemimah Rodrgues makes slow start to WBBL stint Following her World Cup heroics, Jemimah Rodrigues struggled in her first innings in the Women's Big Bash League on Sunday, November 9. Jemimah is playing for the Brisbane Heat in the WBBL.

Ronaldo slams referee with sarcastic rant during Al-Nassr's win over Neom Cristiano Ronaldo was caught on camera aiming a sarcastic outburst at the referee during Al-Nassr's 3-1 win over Neom in the Saudi Pro League on Saturday.

Richa Ghosh, want to see you captain India one day: Sourav Ganguly Former India captain Sourav Ganguly felicitated World Cup winner Richa Ghosh on Saturday, November 8. Ganguly credited Richa for her exceptional performance and said that he wants to see her taking over as the India captain someday.

Lionel Messi masterclass powers Inter Miami past Nashville in MLS Cup Playoffs Lionel Messi led Inter Miami to a decisive 4-0 victory over Nashville SC, securing the club's first advancement in MLS Cup Playoffs history. Messi contributed to every goal, scoring twice and assisting twice, as Miami dominated Game 3 in Fort Lauderdale.

No more experiments: Aakash Chopra's advice to India after Australia T20I series win Former cricketer Aakash Chopra has advised the Indian team management to stop experimenting after they wrapped up the Australia T20I series. India experimented with their batting and bowling during the series win against the Aussies.

After World Cup heroics, Jemimah Rodrgues makes slow start to WBBL stint Following her World Cup heroics, Jemimah Rodrigues struggled in her first innings in the Women's Big Bash League on Sunday, November 9. Jemimah is playing for the Brisbane Heat in the WBBL.

Ronaldo slams referee with sarcastic rant during Al-Nassr's win over Neom Cristiano Ronaldo was caught on camera aiming a sarcastic outburst at the referee during Al-Nassr's 3-1 win over Neom in the Saudi Pro League on Saturday.

Richa Ghosh, want to see you captain India one day: Sourav Ganguly Former India captain Sourav Ganguly felicitated World Cup winner Richa Ghosh on Saturday, November 8. Ganguly credited Richa for her exceptional performance and said that he wants to see her taking over as the India captain someday.

Lionel Messi masterclass powers Inter Miami past Nashville in MLS Cup Playoffs Lionel Messi led Inter Miami to a decisive 4-0 victory over Nashville SC, securing the club's first advancement in MLS Cup Playoffs history. Messi contributed to every goal, scoring twice and assisting twice, as Miami dominated Game 3 in Fort Lauderdale.

Shepherd's late heroics in vain as New Zealand clinch tense win to go 2-1 upNew Zealand pacer Kyle Jamieson held his nerve in the final over, defending 12 runs to help his team withstand Romario Shepherd's late onslaught and seal a thrilling victory over the West Indies in the third T20I.

Mikel Arteta disappointed, frustrated as Arsenal slip to draw against SunderlandMikel Arteta said that he was left disappointed and frustrated by Arsenal's inability to see off Sunderland as they were held to a 2-2 draw. Arsenal let the game slip in the second half stoppage time.

Novak Djokovic wins 101st title, withdraws from ATP Finals due to injuryNovak Djokovic clinched his 101st career title with a hard-fought three-set victory over Lorenzo Musetti at the Hellenic Championship in Athens. However, the world No. 1 later confirmed his withdrawal from the ATP Finals in Turin due to an ongoing shoulder injury.

BCCI-PCB Icebreaker: Dubai Talks To End Asia Cup Trophy Standoff After Weeks Of TensionThis special report focuses on the ongoing tussle between the BCCI and the Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) over the Asia Cup trophy, with key figures being BCCI Secretary Devjit Saikia and PCB Chairperson Mohsin Naqvi. According to Saikia, after a meeting facilitated by the ICC in Dubai, 'We had a cordial discussion on the issue, both sides understood that this has to be sorted out, both sides are positive to sort it out at the earliest possible time.' The dispute began after India won the Asia Cup, and the team reportedly refused to accept the trophy from Naqvi, who is also Pakistan's Interior Minister. The trophy has since been held at the ICC headquarters, with Naqvi insisting he must be the one to present it. Following the informal talks, both cricket boards are now exploring options to reach an amicable solution.

Shivam Dube prepped to carry India's all-round load in Hardik Pandya's absenceShivam Dube is no sudden revelation. With growing confidence and composure as an all-rounder, he offers India the balance they often seek in Hardik Pandya's absence, not as a replacement but as a reliable reinforcement when stability matters most.

Gukesh's elimination sums up miserable 2025 for the World ChampionWorld Chess Champion Gukesh has been eliminated from the Chess World Cup 2025. This has now raised questions about whether he will have the mental fortitude to defend his title in the 2026 World Championships.

When MS Dhoni shielded Shikhar Dhawan gracefully amid the tough Australia tourDuring India's 2014-15 tour of Australia, MS Dhoni publicly dismissed reports of a dressing-room rift between Virat Kohli and Shikhar Dhawan, defending both players in a press conference after the Brisbane Test.

With growing confidence and composure as an all-rounder, he offers India the balance they often seek in Hardik Pandya's absence, not as a replacement but as a reliable reinforcement when stability matters most.

When MS Dhoni shielded Shikhar Dhawan gracefully amid the tough Australia tourDuring India's 2014-15 tour of Australia, MS Dhoni publicly dismissed reports of a dressing-room rift between Virat Kohli and Shikhar Dhawan, defending both players in a press conference after the Brisbane Test.

Richa Ghosh felicitated by CAB after Women's World Cup triumphRicha Ghosh was felicitated by the Cricket Association of Bengal (CAB) at the iconic Eden Gardens in Kolkata following her incredible showing in the Women's World Cup final, where India lifted the title.

Elena Rybakina stuns Aryna Sabalenka to claim maiden WTA Finals titleElena Rybakina defeated world No. 1 Aryna Sabalenka 6‑3, 7‑6 (0) to claim her maiden WTA Finals title in Riyadh, remaining undefeated throughout the tournament. Her victory marked a historic milestone as the first Kazakhstani to win the WTA Finals.

In-form Dhruv Jurel to play as a batter, Nitish Reddy likely to be dropped: ReportRishabh Pant will return as India's first-choice wicketkeeper, but Dhruv Jurel's strong red-ball form means he is set to play as a specialist batter against South Africa. The management is keen to give Jurel a longer run in the middle order.

Leander Paes takes charge as president of Bengal Tennis AssociationLeander Paes officially took charge as president of the Bengal Tennis Association, promising to elevate the sport in his home state. The 18-time Grand Slam champion said the role is emotional, calling it a return to where his journey began.

Real-life Chak De India moment: A huddle, a bubble, and a World CupIndia lifted their first Women's World Cup title, defeating South Africa by 52 runs. Head coach Amol Muzumdar brushed aside "Chak De India" comparisons, saying his huddle talks came from the heart as the team 'wrote their own story'.

Babar Azam in good form, will get big runs very soon: Pakistan coach Mike HessonPAK vs SA: Pakistan coach Mike Hesson has backed Babar Azam to return to form soon, saying the batter is striking the ball well despite low scores against South Africa. In three games, Babar managed only 45 runs at an average of 15.

IPL retention: CSK douse Sanju Samson trade rumours in hilarious video IPL 2026 retention: Moments after the November 15 retention deadline was confirmed, Chennai Super Kings doused trade rumours involving Sanju Samson with a hilarious video featuring CEO Kasi Viswanathan.

Pakistan win historic ODI series vs South Africa after Abrar, Saim shine in deciderPakistan sealed a historic 2-1 ODI series win over South Africa with a commanding seven-wicket victory in Faisalabad. Saim Ayub's fluent 77 and Abrar Ahmed's brilliant 4/27 headlined Pakistan's dominant display as they chased down 144 with 149 balls to spare.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
